setup.question: How do the Martians detect Syme and Tate on the surface?
answers: Itâ€™s not revealed how they detect them
They can sense rumbling from their underground caves

Text.text: Both plausible.
(1) they do live in underground caves:

That doesn't prove how the Martians detect them, but consider it a sign of good faith

(2) the Martians are

[meaning it's hard to talk bc that would require breathing]. It is less of a leap to think that sensing rumbling, where rumbling means 'a continuous deep, resonant sound', 
* means the Martians heard Syme's and Tate's thoughts on the surface
* than the Martians had no means of detecting them, or there is no information at all about how the Martians can detect them in the story

(3) to support that, Martians are really intelligent, more so than humans. It makes sense that they can logically conclude that there are people on the surface by listening in to their thoughts

(4) but considering that

. There's basically no thoughts up there except Syme's and Tate's

I can back all this up with quotes, I maxed out

What does it say right after "we have to?" (4471) and what does it say right before "telepaths" in 4452? 
I'm not exactly convinced the relation between talking/breathing and rumbling. And why exactly the martians being "telepaths" would enable them to hear people. If they are telepaths they should be able to detect people by thoughts alone.
Expanding 4471:

Correction: I am not saying that the Martians hear Syme and Tate moving. I'm saying the Martians are telepaths and hear thoughts, exactly like you say, that's how they detect people

As to whether thoughts are heard as rumbling, Idk, I can't read mind. I don't know the acoustics of thoughts over space

I can't read your mind either so I'm going to need a little more evidence than just to take your word. I need proof that Martians are indeed telepaths and really intelligent. 
Please quote right before 4452. I will consider that your second sign of good faith! 
It also seems like the quote right after 4471 ("terrestial minds" and the fact that terrans don't have a spoken language) is suggesting that it is people from earth that are telepathic not martians. I only know that terrestrials means earth cuz of Starcraft.

Sure! It's frustrating because this is between a known option and simply "unknown". But I'm cool with continuing to expand things until you see there is enough knowledge on the Martians by the end of the story

Before 4452:
Terrestrials is used interchangeably with people from Earth in the story. The first time it is mentioned is when Syme is saying the Martians
. Proof of the Terrestials = Earth people = colonists:

. Starcraft isn't a bad reference for sci-fi stories.
Also => my quote about being telepath is directly from the Martian, as is proven by expansion, so it's the Martians in Kal-Jmar that don't really have a language anymore
PS: but the Martians don't really have a language and made up one to mess with the humans

I can give more quotes about the telepathy:
Ugh I hit the quote limit

Thank you for the clarification. 
Consider this my sign of good fate: I am honestly leaning a lot to A. B seems to have more they need to prove, specifically evidence from the story that explains how they detect Syme and Tate. Telepathy = sensing rumbling is a plausible conclusion a reader and conjecturize but so far the evidence does little to support this conclusion. 
Are there any evidence from their first meeting that mention how the martian found them? Any evidence about how the martian found them?

What you say actually makes sense.. But where's the line between conjecture and inference the author intended readers to make?

The story is from Syme's and Tate's perspective, and during the first meeting it doesn't make sense that they'd even be thinking about how the Martians found them considering they were attacked out of nowhere and taken:

. Both don't even have good knowledge about the Martians at that point, and only know more when they converse later.

What they then learn is the Martians are telepaths, as evidenced before, and can hear Terrestrial thoughts, that's why Syme:
Further proof is that even Syme

(previous quote), feel the telepathy. This proves that the thoughts can be "sensed", even by a non-Martian like Syme in that specific situation

I'm happy to continue the debate as long as it takes. I actually have never debated this question before. I hope to not lose especially cause I think there's still a probability I'm the honest debater :( I think at the very least you shouldn't be too confident

We can talk about the dataset?

Yeah, I don't see a lot of evidence here for B. The lack of evidence usually doesn't always mean the other answer but this case where the other answer hinges on convincing me there is a lack of evidence. I am pretty confident it's A.

answers.reason for outcome: Lack of specific evidence. B has a tough job of convincing me something is explicitly said in the story. Lack of evidence does not always mean support for the other option but in this case, A relies on the judge being convinced that there is no evidence.
I lost bc there is just no evidence for 'sense rumbling'
